name: Causal Inference Quick Start
description: Get started with causal inference in 2 hours. Learn the fundamentals through the best free resources, then get hands-on with Python tools.

items.name: Causal Inference for the Brave and True
items.why: The best free online book - builds intuition with Python examples

items.name: The Effect (Book)
items.why: Nick Huntington-Klein's excellent introduction with clear explanations

items.name: DoWhy
items.why: Microsoft's causal inference library - easiest to start with

items.name: CausalML
items.why: Uber's uplift modeling library - great for treatment effect estimation

items.name: DoWhy User Guide
items.why: Official documentation with step-by-step tutorials

name: Production A/B Testing
description: Everything you need to run trustworthy experiments at scale. From statistical foundations to variance reduction techniques.

items.name: Trustworthy Online Controlled Experiments
items.why: The definitive guide by Ron Kohavi - covers everything from basics to pitfalls

items.name: Evan Miller's A/B Testing Tools
items.why: Essential calculators for sample size, significance, and stopping rules

items.name: Evan Miller: How Not To Run an A/B Test
items.why: Classic article on peeking and multiple comparisons problems

items.name: Netflix Tech Blog: Experimentation
items.why: Real-world experimentation at scale from Netflix's data science team

items.name: Matteo Courthoud: Understanding CUPED
items.why: Clear explanation of variance reduction with pre-experiment data

items.name: Spotify Confidence
items.why: Spotify's open-source library for sequential testing and confidence intervals

name: Difference-in-Differences Deep Dive
description: Master modern DiD methods including staggered adoption, heterogeneous treatment effects, and robust estimators.

items.name: A Practitioner's Guide to DiD
items.why: Comprehensive guide to modern DiD methods and when to use each

items.name: Causal Inference: The Mixtape
items.why: Scott Cunningham's excellent textbook with DiD chapter

items.name: csdid (Callaway-Sant'Anna)
items.why: Python implementation of the Callaway & Sant'Anna estimator for staggered DiD

items.name: Differences
items.why: Flexible Python package for DiD with multiple estimators

items.name: synthdid
items.why: Synthetic Difference-in-Differences combining SC and DiD

items.name: Netflix: Causal Inference Applications
items.why: Real-world DiD applications at Netflix

name: Marketing Mix Modeling
description: Learn to measure marketing effectiveness with Bayesian MMM. From theory to implementation with Google and PyMC tools.

items.name: PyMC Marketing
items.why: Modern Bayesian MMM with excellent documentation and tutorials

items.name: LightweightMMM
items.why: Google's JAX-based MMM library - production-ready and scalable

items.name: CausalPy Documentation
items.why: PyMC Labs' library with MMM examples and synthetic control

items.name: Lifetimes (CLV)
items.why: Customer lifetime value modeling - pairs well with MMM

items.name: mmm_stan
items.why: Stan-based MMM implementation with clear model specification

name: Causal Discovery Fundamentals
description: Learn to discover causal structure from data. From DAGs and conditional independence to modern algorithms.

items.name: causal-learn
items.why: PyWhy's comprehensive causal discovery library - PC, FCI, GES, and more

items.name: gCastle
items.why: Huawei's causal discovery toolkit with NOTEARS and gradient-based methods

items.name: LiNGAM
items.why: Linear non-Gaussian acyclic models for causal discovery

items.name: Causal Discovery Toolbox
items.why: Unified interface for multiple causal discovery algorithms

items.name: Causal ML Book (Chernozhukov et al.)
items.why: MIT course materials with causal discovery chapters

items.name: Tigramite
items.why: Time series causal discovery - essential for temporal data
